products.description: Looking for a savory mix to bring your recipes to the next level? Try our Dried Wild Gourmet Bolete Mix, which contains a mixture of mushrooms in the edible Boletus species. Our Wild Gourmet Bolete Mix are 100 percent wild-foraged from the incredible forests in Saratoga County. We hand-pick specimen, clean, and dehydrate them so you can enjoy our bounty no matter the season.

metadata.product_usage:
Use our Dried Wild Gourmet Bolete Mix the way you might use any other dried mushroom. Try rehydrating the mushrooms in warm water before using. Crush them up to use with spices or to encrust proteins before cooking. Our Dried Wild Gourmet Bolete Mix Is incredibly versatile—excellent in salts, soups, stews, meats, and more. Anywhere you want to boost your umami, add our Dried Wild Gourmet Bolete Mix!

Please note that dried mushrooms are considered a raw product and should not be consumed before cooking.

products.title: Coop's Vegan Hot Fudge
products.description:
Hot fudge is a sauce so iconic, we knew we had to spend the time to get it right. So, we’ve been mastering the craft since 2010—and wanted to make sure our vegan friends don’t miss out. Handmade in small batches with high-grade European chocolate and silky coconut cream, Coop’s Vegan Hot Fudge is the real deal. It’s why VegNews called it the “best ice cream topping of 2022.” 

Deep and dark, this indulgent sauce has just the right touch of coconut-y sweetness—unlike other sticky vegan versions that only taste like sugar.

metadata.product_usage: It’s instantly rich and impeccably smooth, gooey right out of the jar but drizzly once warmed. Atop ice cream it hardens to the perfect soft chew, but we don’t stop there—spread it on brownies, drip it over fruit, plunge your pretzels into it or devour it straight by the spoonful. Just don’t be surprised when it disappears…non-vegans love it too.
metadata.product_arrival: Coop's Vegan Hot Fudge arrives in a glass jar.
metadata.product_storage: Refrigerate after opening.

products.title: Coop's Salted Caramel Sauce
products.description:
Once we mastered hot fudge, it was time to perfect its soulmate: caramel sauce. Made in small batches with copper kettles for better temperature control, Coop’s Salted Caramel Sauce is crafted with pure dairy, cane sugar and salt for an addictive result. With a deep caramelized flavor and precisely the right pop of salt, this balanced sauce is an upgrade from what you’ll find in the grocery store. 

All Natural. Gluten Free. No Preservatives. Star-K Kosher Dairy. Non-GMO.

metadata.product_usage: Rich and silky with a sticky, satisfying pull, it drizzles flawlessly over ice cream while still staying creamy. But don’t stop there—spread it on brownies, drip it over apple slices, plunge your pretzels into it or devour it straight by the spoonful. We don’t judge!

products.title: Blue Java 'Ice Cream' Bananas — Fresh Tropical Fruit — SHIPS 1/3
products.description:
This listing is for a box of fresh Blue Java bananas aka 'Ice Cream' bananas. Blue Java bananas are most notable for their matte blue coloring, compared to their green counterparts (though they can become blue-green as they approach maturity!).

These unique blue bananas turn light yellow when ready to eat. Thanks to their dense and creamy texture, ice cream bananas are not only excellent eaten out-of-hand, but are also great for - you guessed it - homemade ice cream.

1 pound ≈ 4-6 bananas
2.5 pounds ≈ 8-12 bananas
5 pounds ≈ 20+ bananas

Please contact me with any questions or concerns.

CALIFORNIA BUYERS: Blue Java Bananas are APPROVED for shipment to CA. Enjoy!

products.title: Dried Yellowfoot Mushrooms
products.description: Yellowfoot Mushrooms aka (Winter Chanterelles) are wild foraged in the high Pacific Northwest forest. We gently dry brush / clean them and naturally air dry them. They have a pleasant and slightly fruity smell and mild earthy mushroomy flavor. They’re very delicate, have a hollow stem and are quite small. Yellow Foot chanterelles are popularly sautéed in butter and spices and served as a stand-alone side dish, stuffed into pasta, layered in a roast beef sandwich, or are served with lightly flavored vegetable dishes, meats, and soups. They can also be cooked in stews, used in stocks, chopped into stuffing. Yellowfoot mushrooms pair well with goose, grilled fish, steak, bacon, eggs, carrots, celery, radicchio, onion, shallots, herbs and spices such as sage, rosemary, tarragon, marjoram, dill, thyme, parsley, and saffron, barley, polenta, wild rice, brandy, white wine, beef stock, cream, and potatoes. Easily rehydrated by soaking in water 1 hour or overnight.

products.title: Dried Turkey Tail Mushrooms
products.description:
One of the most well-known medicinal mushroom is Turkey Tail - also known as Coriolus versicolor. Ours is wild foraged in the lower mountains of the Pacific Northwest. Hand foraged, brushed and naturally air dried.

Health benefits include enhancement of your immune system. High in phenol and flavonoid antioxidants that fight cellular damage and inflammation. These have been used in Asia for a very long time for medicinal purposes including the prevention of cold, providing support during chemotherapy, managing diabetes, reducing inflammation, lowering cholesterol, and more.

Soak in hot water for 2 hours to make a tea and strain. Do not boil.

Note: Can cause bloating and gas - due diligence recommended before using any naturopathic remedies.

products.title: Pine Resin Salve aka Drawing Salve "Splinter Sticks" or tins
products.description:
When a Pine tree is injured, it releases a glue like resin to heal and protect itself. We have carefully collected only the excess dried sap from Loblolly and White Pine trees without exposing the wounds. After rendering it down to a beautiful healing golden glue, the resin is mixed with Organic Sesame and Olive Oils that have been infused with baby Pine Needles, and then hardened with some local Beeswax from The Charmer Bee Co in West Georgia. 

Pine Salve is known as a drawing salve.. meaning it draws toxins out from the skin. This salve is great for:

Splinters
Bug Bite Toxins
Glass
Blackheads
Ingrown Hair 
Eczema
Rashes
..and more!

The salve is available in convenient sticks for hands free application or 1 oz tins if you prefer.

ALLERGEN WARNING: CONTAINS SESAME

products.title: Fresh Pacific Northwest (Oregon/ Washington) White Truffle (SMALLS)
products.description:
Tuber oregonense, known as the Oregon Winter White Truffle, is native to the Pacific Northwest of North America, ranging from northern California to British Columbia, and is commonly found in Douglas Fir forests. They are prized for their umami-like and potent truffly or slightly garlic or diesel aroma.

This white truffle is prized for its intense aroma and is used sliced, shaved, or grated over pasta, risotto, vegetables, or eggs and also used to infuse butter, oils, and meats.

Oregon winter white truffles are found from November through March. These are harvested from our private forest stands in Washington & Oregon where we work with small timberland owners to keep the land in working forests.

Oregon White truffles range in size but are normally on the small side, ranging from the size of a pea to a golf ball. We do occasionally find 'icon' size Oregon white truffles in excess of 2 ounces (about 60 g +). If you are interested white truffles of this size, please contact us directly to be notified when they are found. 

These truffles are all considered EXTRA CLASS BUT SMALL, and all are found by our dogs. Every one. That's super important to us as it ensures quality as well as sustainability. Beware- not everyone who says "dog harvested" actually does! 

These truffles range is size from a dime to maybe a Nickle or a bit larger. They are great for chopping up, infusing, or anything you can think of. They are still big enough to grate or shave (watch those fingertips!), but are on the smaller size and therefore more economical. The aroma is NOT impacted by Size.

We recommend this product is consumed as soon as possible, within 1 week.

metadata.product_usage:
Please contact us for a full care guide (Included with your order) and recipes.
-Keep your truffles in a Tupperware or glass container with a lid in the fridge. The average fridge temperature is fine. Avoid freezing.
- The inside of your container should be lined with absorbent paper towels and if possible limit the
contact between truffles.
- Replace the paper towels once daily. When doing so, before restoring, wipe excess moisture from the inside of the storage container. 
-DO NOT peel them. We suggest you slide, shave thinly, or microplane the truffles into and on top of your favorite dishes or to INFUSE
- Please message us for recipes and infusion ideas. You can infuse foods with truffle while you store them in your fridge. A little goes a long way with this species!

products.title: Turkey Tail Trametes Versicolor Dried
products.description:
We foraged these beautiful Trametes versicolor Turkey Tail mushrooms in a clean area of beautiful West Georgia forest on Dec 28 2023. Their velvety blue hues are exceptionally beautiful. They are abundant in Georgia forests this time of year and we are excited to share this functional mushroom with you!

These turkey tail have been brushed off and trimmed and will arrive to you whole and in pieces, in a resealable airtight bag.

Trametes versicolor has been used for centuries in Native American, Chinese, Ayurvedic, and other Traditional medicines. Recently Turkey tail has gained great attention for its potential in supporting cancer patients. 

Turkey tail are a sturdy mushroom that stores well. In addition to the health benefits, it is also suitable for use as a medium in nature art due to its durability and texture.

metadata.product_usage: To unlock their potential, Turkey Tail can be made into extract powder, tinctures, soup stocks, or teas. They can even be brewed into Kombucha or soaked into Fire Ciders or Meades and Beers! There are many creative uses to incorporate the health benefits of Turkey Tail into your diet.

products.title: North Carolina Grown Perigord Truffles
products.description:
Tuber melanosporum is known around the world as the culinary diamond of the kitchen. Also referred to as the black winter truffle, or mostly commonly as the Perigord truffle, named after one of the regions in France where it is commonly collected.  Perigord truffles are native to Europe but they are also successfully cultivated in other parts of the globe, such as Australia, and now here successfully in the US!

These truffles are grown the lush soils of Northern Carolina! We always support and promote local products, and the access to these amazing truffles quality is nothing like you’ve ever had before! When you purchase these truffles, you are supporting small family farms in the region. Did you know that some of the yummy volatile aromas of these truffles you can only get within 24-48 hrs of the ground? When possible these are shipped out to you the day they are harvested!

Think earthy with aromas that bring to mind damp forests, with hints of molasses, chocolate and tobacco- and from this particular farm, aromatics of malt and earth!

Perigord  truffles have a dark outer skin with large, diamond-shaped pyramids, and a marbled chocolate or deep slate grey-colored interior when ripe.

They are served raw on warm dishes, but also can be heated (slightly) to release a more robust flavor and aroma, and are ideal for infusions.

We recommend this product is consumed as soon as possible, within 1 week. If stored properly they can have a longer shelf life, but aromatics decrease with time.

All Perigord truffles are listed at Market Price.

*All of our truffles are harvested by dog & handler location teams and sourced from farms we work with and visit ourselves by either our dogs or theirs. We can even send you a photo of the dog that harvested your truffles.

You will receive a truffle care instruction guide with each purchase.

*These are listed as EXTRA CLASS TRUFFLES. 1st Class, as well as 2nd class & Pieces are also available at slightly decreased prices. Msg us for more info!

products.title: Red & Yellow 2 Tone Tagetes Patula Flower Seeds
products.description:
Welcome to another fantastic garden addition! Marigolds serve many purposes in the garden. They are know to help keep mosquitos away, they are a great border flower as they are a natural deer & rabbit deterent, butterflies love them, the list goes on and on.

These plants are not only beneficial in the garden, but they can be used to make to make healing herbal ointments, teas, tinctures and topical treatments that have been in existence for almost 1,000 years.

Marigold flowers have many impressive health benefits. A particular species of marigold flower, Calendula officinalis (commonly just called calendula or “pot marigold”), is used to make healing herbal ointments, teas, tinctures and topical treatments that have been in existence for almost 1,000 years. Benefits and uses for Calendula officinalis marigolds include treating conditions, such as rashes, allergies, eczema and dermatitis; pain, swelling and redness caused from muscle cramps, muscular injuries or sprains; eye inflammation and itchiness caused by conjunctivitis; and fungal infections, including athlete’s foot, candida, ear infections and ringworm.

Each lot will contain 2.5 grams of seeds. That may not sound like much, but it takes a couple hundred seeds to weigh that much.

Another awesome thing about marigolds, they reseed themselves! You can choose to dead head the blossoms, or let them reseed and spread.

They are also excellent choices for classrooms! Students can plant a single seed and watch daily as they flowers grow and bloom. The grow quickly so students can learn the entire growth process. After the flowers bud out and bloom, it makes a great take home gift for the family. Something that they can be quite proud of.

If you have any questions please feel free to contact me with them.

products.title: California Bay Laurel Leaves Wild grown
products.description:
Welcome to our selection of premium California bay leaves, handpicked and carefully sourced to bring you the finest quality for your culinary and health needs.

Our California bay leaves, scientifically known as Umbellularia californica, offer a distinct aroma and robust flavor to elevate your cooking experience. These leaves, harvested from the Monterey Bay laurel tree, are rich in essential oils that impart a unique, slightly spicy, and aromatic taste to soups, stews, sauces, and various dishes.

Antibacterial and Antifungal Properties: Compounds found in California bay leaves possess antibacterial and antifungal properties, which may help combat certain pathogens and fungi when used in herbal preparations.

Immune system health. Bay leaf is a good source of vitamin A, vitamin B6, and vitamin C. These vitamins are all known to support a healthy immune system.

Anti-inflammatory Effects: The leaves contain compounds that exhibit anti-inflammatory properties, potentially aiding in reducing inflammation and associated discomfort.

Digestive Support: Bay leaves are known for their ability to support digestion. They may help alleviate digestive issues like bloating, gas, and indigestion due to their natural enzymes.

Antioxidant Richness: These leaves are packed with antioxidants, which can help neutralize harmful free radicals in the body and reduce oxidative stress.

Respiratory Health: Inhalation of bay leaf steam or infusion may help in relieving respiratory issues like congestion, coughs, and mild respiratory infections due to their natural aromatic compounds.

Rich in Essential Nutrients: California bay leaves contain various vitamins and minerals, including vitamin A, vitamin C, vitamin B-complex, calcium, potassium, magnesium, and manganese, offering a boost to overall health.

Potential Blood Sugar Regulation: Some studies suggest that compounds in bay leaves might aid in regulating blood sugar levels, which could be beneficial for individuals managing diabetes.

Pain Relief: Topical application or use in massages with bay leaf oil may provide mild pain relief due to their analgesic properties.

Stress Reduction: The aroma of bay leaves, when used in aromatherapy or herbal teas, might contribute to stress reduction and relaxation.

Skin Health: Extracts or infusions of bay leaves are believed to have potential benefits for the skin, including soothing minor skin irritations and acting as a natural cleanser.

While California bay leaves offer these potential health benefits, it's essential to consult with a healthcare professional before using them for medicinal purposes, especially if you have any underlying health conditions or are on medications, to ensure they complement your health regime

products.description:
the cleavers are tinctured fresh in vodka in early spring. the marsmallow leaf, root + flower were home grown and tinctured fresh in grain alcohol at their respective peak seasons. i grew them from seed. the roots were 3-4 years old. the black raspberry leaf was wild foraged in spring and tinctured fresh in vodka. i made this blend with hopes that we will stop bombing our ladies with antibiotics and resolve the real root causes of UTI and repeat UTIs. 

this is a great, simple + safe remedy for UTI's and especially repeat UTI's. prompt, reliable relief. 
most of the time repeat UTI's are due to a weakness in the urinary tract. that weakness makes it easy for pathology and or irritation to set in. the space needs to be strengthened, moisturized + protected. it's usually a quick fix. as opposed to waiting several days for relief, you're looking at an hour or two. 

marshmallow is a great general mucilage. it cools, soothes + moisturizes inflamed tissues. cleavers is specific to lymph and to the urinary system at large. it will cool and rinse the kidneys, their connections to the bladder, and the bladder itself. raspberry leaf is a great remedy for the female system at large but it really shines in strengthening and toning weak tissues. it's a great astringent and works promptly. all together these herbs reduce burning, irritation + the constant need to pee. 

one dropper full three times a day for the first 1-3 days. when you feel better, then drop it down to 1 dropper full a day. if you're a repeat UTI kinda gal you can keep taking 1 dropper full a day. drink ample water while you're taking this remedy. the cleavers will clean house through urine. the underlying issue will resolve and you won't need it anymore after a bottle. if that's not the case, message me and we'll look at your specific situation and figure it out. 

3 dropper fulls a day is not a sustainable dose. you take it until you feel better. then you drop it down to a more typical dose. the reason is that it takes about 5 days to really get into the lymph level. so if by day 5 you've been taking a lot of some quiet lymphatic herb for 5 whole days, you can flush your lymph too fast. and it's safe but definitely uncomfy. this is true of cleavers, plantain, violet, rose + self heal to name a few. quiet, gentle yin herbs are powerful in ways that may surprise you. 

if you prefer a tea to tincture, you can peek my herbal blend called 'boundaries'. it is marshmallow based and is wonderful support + relief for menstrual issues as well as for UTIs. 

worth mentioning that sometimes people need st johnswort for their repeat UTIs. this tends to be when they have some kind of chronic bacterial infection. it's not super common, but especially if you've ever had a catheter, stayed in the hospital for an extended time or have really bombed yourself with antibiotics in this life, those situations can arise. i've seen older ladies get e coli infections in their bladder. please feel free to message me if you have any questions or concerns about this. these kinds of situations are handled nicely with st johnswort tea or tincture (very safe but it can interact with meds) and a tiny .5oz barberry root tincture on the side. if you look at my st johnswort description and think, wow that sounds like an herb that fits me on several levels, choose st johnswort instead of this remedy. 

i consult for free for your safety and benefit. please reach out any time with questions or inquiries!

products.title: wild foraged motherwort tincture- tinctured fresh
products.description:
this tincture was made with fresh motherwort that by luck grew wild in my field
it was harvested in late summer and tinctured fresh in vodka

motherwort is a specific for 
heart palpitations + womb troubles

ive had a client in her late 20s who had severe period pain since she began puberty. we had gotten it down to the first two days being a problem, but returning to normalcy after that. i don't typically have a hard time resolving painful menstrual issues. at worst endometriosis type ladies sometimes need to keep taking remedies to keep the issue at bay, which is not my favorite modus operandi but is safe and better than having a recurring problem for a week out of the month. but i had tried all of my tried and true painful cycle remedies and i couldn't figure out how to get her all the way better. it was really bothering me. i was reading a description of motherwort in a book from the 1600s. i gave her an ounce of motherwort tincture and said take 10 drops before bed. it was 11 days before her next period. she took the 10 drops nightly for those 11 days. no pain at all for the first time ever. 

typically clotting and pain is a congestion issue. there are lots of ways to fix it. increasing blood flow to the pelvis and reproductive organs is usually good enough. lifestyle factors are a big consideration here (ie: a giant iced coffee on your period is just begging for trouble) but now i'm realizing that sometimes the root issue can be uterine spasm. there are other remedies for uterine spasm, but motherwort was just excellent. motherwort is clearly antispasmodic and antianxiety. it's a known heart tonic. in the moment, it works promptly and well- though steady low doses are superior and work to normalize the underlying issue in time. it is a strong bitter and good for sluggish digestion. it sweeps phlegm from the chest and is an over all circulatory tonic. 

it is said to be good for 'troubles of the mother' and good for those who are in need a good mother. it is covered in both pretty pink flowers and sharp thorns. it is feminine and protective. 
flowers and thorns are placed at perfect intervals on the square stem- an indication that it brings rhythm and regularity. it is considered specific for women who have emotional imbalances that directly correlate to hormonal shifts. 

i  consult for free for your safety and benefit. please feel free to reach out any time with questions or just go ahead and send over an outline of what's going on. i respond promptly and am glad to help!

products.title: fresh hyssop tincture- homegrown + tinctured fresh
products.description:
Hyssopus officinalis - i've been trying to grow it for 5 years!
this year it decided to grace us and i'm so glad to have this tincture. 
hyssop is a very ancient herb from the mint family. 
it is famously mentioned in the bible
'Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean' psalm 51:7 
but it's all over the old testament. 

i love hyssop. i use it to clean, clear, tone + astringe. 
it's an herb that opens the 'tubes' of the body. 
it will sweep phlegm out of places you didn't know it was hiding. 
it is diaphoretic so it will open the pores and encourage sweating- good for fevers.
it's a bronchodilator so it's nice for when you're feeling wheezy and congested. 

it's particularly nice for GI distress as it's an excellent carminative that can simultaneously soothe, check and get things moving. it is antispasmodic, carminative, acts as a nervine and is an absolutely excellent antiseptic. 

DIVERTICULITIS 
when herbal antiseptics are taken properly, they can take care of bad stuff without damaging good stuff. 
i particularly like to use hyssop for diverticulitis.
this is a condition that runs in my family so i have had the occasion to work with it quite a bit. this past summer a family member was day 3 on the couch with a flare up. they could hardly sit up. i was horrified to see they were taking blood root pills that they'd bought from the health food store. they said 'they were making it worse but the lady at the store said it was like antibiotics and they make you worse to make you better' no. not safe- and thankfully, not necessary! 
they had creeping charlies growing in a beautiful clump beside the porch. a strong cup of tea had them walking in an hour. a regimen of hyssop + creeping charlies tea 3-4 c a day for 7-10 days completely ended the episode. feel an episode coming on? start the hyssop + creeping charlies tea. it's very safe. 

AUTOIMMUNE
i find hyssop to be an important herb for autoimmune type issues.  it does depend on presentation and root issue, which is sometimes clear and sometimes isn't. but we look for 3 things in working on the roots of these conditions: 1) we have to help the body clean something up that it can't figure out how to detox on it's own.
my go to's that i think of first are st johnswort, blue vervain + hyssop. we don't use them all together! it's really important to keep it simple in these situations because they're sensitive and their flare ups can be really awful for them. i'm not a great believer of the 'healing crisis'. we look into a person's presentation and match them with a detox herb that suits them very well. small steady doses are great. 
then 2) we help them find a deeper sense of balance and give the body complex nutrition that fuels change that the body might not be able to fuel on it's own. i typically use reishi here but medicinal mushrooms and sometimes other supportive adaptogens are good choices here. it's common to have a complex pathogen like a virus as the root issue in autoimmune issues. remedies like reishi can help the immune system correct itself and find more effective ways to handle a complicated invader. 
3) i always like to mention that it's critical that we see if anything is 'in the way' of correcting a health issue. if there is an unidentified trigger that's regularly happening and we don't remove it, our results will always be limited. if we can identify triggers and eliminate them, we can find great success with the correct regimen. hidden food allergies, exposure to molds or toxins + medications that your body is having an untoward reaction to can all be big things to consider here. 


i consult for free for your safety and benefit. please feel free to send me a message any time. blessings!

products.title: calendula tincture- flower + herb homegrown + tinctured fresh
products.description:
i grew this calendula from strictly medicinal's seeds
i slowly harvested them throughout their peek season as they bloomed. 
i tinctured both flower tops and clean stem + leaves in vodka

calendula is an important ingredient in my all purpose healing salve and is famously good for mending external abrasions and bruises. it's also excellent + very reliable for weepy, irritated skin conditions like eczema. it is also in my winter detox tincture (calendula, yarrow, burdock + dandelion) because it is a warming herb that stimulates lymph to drain. if you grow calendula at home you might notice that it lasts for most of the winter, looking pretty good even under the snow. a true herb of the sun! 

on top of being great for draining lymph, it's quite reliable as an antibacterial, antiviral + antifungal. i love to use it for fungal issues that don't want to clear up (see also bee balm) even in modern scientific studies, it has impressive effects on immunity. 

in short, calendula clears, cleanses + sanitizes spaces. it is an alterative to it can adjust between polarities. 
ie: for menstrual support it can open and help expel congestion that causes delayed on set, clotting and pain but can also tone up the reproductive organs when they're too lax and bleeding excessively. 
it will sweep out phlegm from places you didn't know it was hiding. 
so don't be surprised to find it being expelled from here and there. 
it opens and clears the 'tubes of the body' and can also open pores to induce sweating. 

my reliable go to uses for calendula are: 
-for eczema and weepy skin conditions (including both internal + topical use)
-for fungal infections that don't want to clear up (including candida)
-for sluggish lymph with cold digestion, low immunity and tendency to feel cold
-stomach ulcers caused by cold stagnant/apathetic digestion.

products.title: wild foraged chamomile tincture- tinctured fresh
products.description:
this chamomile was growing wild in a happy field by my house. i harvested the plant probably ten times over the course of summer to achieve a half gallon of fresh tincture. i was sure to promptly tincture the fresh flowers in vodka to preserve the volatile oils. a quality remedy! 

GI PAIN AND ISSUES
every old herb book, regardless of culture, says the same thing about chamomile:
it is the number one herb for a tormented belly regardless of the root issue. it is said to be excellent in bilious complaints and passing stones. perhaps this is my new go to for belly problems. i don't have a lot of experience with chamomile specifically in terms of GI complaints. it is in 2/3 dream team blends (ko'd and count sheep) for sleep teas. i would be very grateful for any feed back regarding GI distress and chamomile that i can add to my collected research and personal understanding of the herb. 

EMOTIONAL PROFILE
matthew wood and william lesassier talk about chamomile being the go to remedy 'for babies of any age'. people who are fickle, emotionally labile and whiney- *especially* when they are sick or in pain. i don't want anyone's feelings to be hurt by that indication. i actually think this is a wonderful remedy to soothe your inner child. many people grew up feeling like their needs were not met and that the squeaky wheel gets the grease. it is never too late to work on those feelings and seek appropriate support for that work. (both motherwort and black walnut have ties to mother-child relationships) 

matthew wood says chamomile people are said to vocalize their struggles and ask for love and help, whereas agrimony people hide their pain and troubles, letting them fester and turn into inner tensions. 

chamomile is no doubt a very safe herb. a small handful of allergic reactions have occurred and popular busy body articles were written about it. i have had many requests for sleep teas with no chamomile because people with ragweed allergies feel they're at risk. please always do what makes you feel safe, but also know that this is not a common issue. there are many common herbs in the Asteraceae family as well as many common foods. chamomile is an extremely popular herb world wide and is safe enough to give to pregnant women, nursing mothers and children. not to mention- any time you try a new herb you should start with a very small dose! 

i consult for free for your safety and benefit. please feel free to send me a message any time!

products.title: holy basil krishna tincture- tinctured fresh + home grown
products.description:
i grew this holy basil krishna from seeds (strictly medicinal seeds) 
and tinctured it fresh in vodka at peak season.

ayurveda calls holy basil krishna 'the queen of all herbs' 
it is an excellent adaptogen (and a true adaptogen) meaning it helps the body respond to stress appropriately and return to center both chemically and physiologically. 
this is a tropical member of the mint family that is sacred and very popular in india and ayurveda. 
in my 6b nick of the woods, i grow it as an annual and tincture it fresh on a hot sunny day. 
like many members of the mint family it is very safe and has complex herbal actions. 
it opens, clears and balances and is said to help bring balance to the 'head, heart and stomach' but has long been used with great success for lung conditions and metabolic disorders. 

it is a rasayana herb, just like ashwagandha. that means it restores vitality when it is lacking and is very safe for everyone from the very young, to the sensitive and compromised, to the very old. 
below i've outlined some traditional uses for holy basil krishna. this is in no way an exhaustive list 

ANXIETY/DEPRESSION
this would be a good choice for someone that struggles with anxiety, depression and is prone to catching whatever the latest bug is during cold and flu season. it is both calming and stimulating and is a very good expectorant. so don't be surprised if you cough up some gunk you didn't know was in there. that's a great example of how an herb can be both relaxing and stimulating. it relaxes and opens the airways while also stimulating the lungs to release stuck or apathetic phlegm. 

DIGESTION/LIVER
holy basil krishna can be an excellent digestive ally for these same reasons. relax tension, stimulate proper digestive function. the mint family has a nice way of correcting inappropriate actions that arise or have become chronic due to emotional imbalances and trauma. it can warm up cold, apathetic and poorly timed digestive reflexes in the people with deficiencies. it can also can cool, soothe and relax hot excess conditions- especially if they are triggered by stress and tension.  i recently learned that holy basil is also an excellent detoxifying agent and has long been used in ayurveda to clean metals, toxins and drugs (especially marijuana) out of the system (wood, 2008).

BLOOD SUGAR/ CARDIOVASCULAR/ INVASIVE TREATMENT SUPPORT
it had excellent results in a study concerning blood sugar stability in diabetics. it also seems to be very useful in reducing blood pressure and stress on the heart. i have personally found it useful for heart discomfort in people who have really over taxed their nervous systems. multiple studies confirm protective and restorative properties for people who are undergoing serious treatments and recovering from them. this herb has truly been extensively studied and validated by modern science. you could read study after study. 

SMOKING CESSATION
this is a great expectorant and great mood support. it should help your body adjust to the newness on a chemical level. pair it with mullein and plantain, my long loved smoking cessation duo. i typically would add skull cap or ashwagandha root to the mullein and plantain, depending on how a person experiences stress, but i've since moved into the holy basil krishna camp for this purpose. 

HEADACHES
there are several members of the mint family that are a great choice for headaches and migraines. i'm starting to think holy basil krishna may be my new first choice. this herb is an excellent and true adaptogen. adaptogens go into your body, make an assessment and bring a deeper sense of homeostasis to the body than the body is able to do on its own at that time. every one

i consult for free for your safety + benefit. please feel free to send me a message if you have any questions at all. you may send over an outline of your situation at any time and i will respond promptly. blessings!

products.title: early spring tulip poplar bark- wild foraged + tinctured fresh
products.description:
this is my first year making this remedy so while i'm very excited to release it, i have limited personal experience with this remedy. i will describe it as i have learned from very good practitioners with extensive experience. 

tulip poplar is a very pretty tree from the magnolia family. the bark has slightly different energetics depending on what time of year the bark is harvested. this past spring i found a youngish tulip poplar that had been blown over in a storm. what luck! i had wanted to add this remedy to my collection for several years but i do not cut bark off of live, healthy trees. i stripped the bark while it was fresh and tinctured it in 1/3 grain 2/3 vodka. because it was nice and early in the season, the bark has a bit of sweetness to it. it's acrid and it is a bitter, but is less bitter in spring than it would be in summer or fall. 

RECOVERY FROM SERIOUS ILLNESS
the most specific indication that i know for tulip poplar bark is that it helps people get stronger after serious illness has worn them down. it is an excellent digestive tonic. it was once used as a quinine substitute for malaria, which famously causes bad fevers and trembling that wear out the autonomic nervous system. any time there is extended exhaustion and trembling (let alone fever), digestive reflexes tend to become strongly disrupted. this can extend into the cardiovascular system and cause undue stress on the heart and vessels.  native americans in particular used tulip poplar bark very extensively and one of their most prominent uses was as a trusted heart tonic.  

the energetics of tulip poplar are important.
herbal academy has a nice definition of acrid herbs:
'acrid herbs have an irritating sensation in the mouth and are often analgesic and antispasmodic'

acrid herbs can return appropriate tension to the autonomic nervous system. and while some acrid herbs can definitely cause an 'irritating' sensation in the mouth (lobelia) it's not always so forward (black cohosh). herbal actions begin with tasting the herb. your nervous system begins to respond before you've even swallowed your remedy. acrid remedies are important because they can truly 'correct' settings that have gone awry from the stress and strife of serious illness or trauma. they are both stimulating and deeply relaxing- and as mentioned they do typically have some degree of pain support in them. tulip poplar does contain some salicylates, which is the active ingredient in aspirin. if you have aspirin allergies, tulip poplar would be contraindicated for you. 

poplar bark is almost always taken in a larger formula. it was commonly taken with orange peel and other milder digestive tonics + bitters. i'd be glad to make you a custom remedy if you're interested. 
this would also be a great companion tincture (as a .5oz) for my balance blend tincture (reishi, holy basil krishna, ashwagandha) which is fine to dose more liberally. add 1-3 drops of tulip poplar for every dropper full of balance blend. 

i consult for free for your safety and benefit! please feel free to reach out any time with questions, an outline of your health situation or inquiries for custom remedies. blessings!

products.title: yellow dock root tincture- wild foraged + tinctured fresh
products.description:
i harvest yellow dock at the end of summer through the end of fall. i only harvest them once the leaves and seeds have turned bronze, an old time indication of iron. 
i only dig the roots near or on the new moon and if there have been proper weather conditions. this ensures that the roots are rich in nutrients and will make potent tinctures!

from the start, yellow dock is not for everyone and it's often used in small doses. it's not dangerous, it just has specific actions that beautifully remedy certain imbalances. 
if you don't have those imbalances, you don't require its services. it may be important to have yellow dock in a minimal formula for optimal results. 
i do consult for free so don't hesitate to reach out if you're in need of specific support! 

ANEMIA + WEAK BLOOD
i use yellow dock in minimal formulas to benefit leaky gut + poor nutrient absorption, particularly when there is long standing anemia. 
i find it incredibly troublesome that so many women struggle with weak and insufficient blood.
it causes other troubles and is a constant stress on the system. 
blood is our main liquid medium through which our insides and their networks are nourished + signaled. 
western medicine doesn't often find anemia to be a big deal. chinese medicine thinks it's a huge problem. i tend to agree with the ladder. 
modern medicine's stance is that it won't kill you. very likely to be true! but your quality of life on a day to day level can really take a hit
and chronic stresses on the body can weaken your vitality and lead to bigger issues down the line

if it applies to you, peek my female support tincture (blk raspberry leaf, stinging nettle, red clover + yellow dock)
it's a great tonic 

I'd like to mention that there are a couple of constitutions that have trouble with anemia. the hotter, more excess conditions are under the typical GI profile below. 
women with this constitution can have very hot, heavy periods that deplete them. this is often easily checked. some lifestyle considerations may be important for deeper resolution.

if you're more of a 'deficient type' of anemia (cold, sluggish, apathetic, dry or mucousy) you can still use yellow dock with success.
consider adding reishi to warm you up and tonify the over all system. 
or i also have a great balance blend tincture (holy basil krishna, ashwagandha root + reishi) that would go great with a tiny yellow dock tincture on the side. 

GI CONSIDERATIONS 
yellow dock is lovely for regulating the bowels. it balances peristalsis to remedy loose bowels (even in extreme cases).
it inspires healthy bile ejection and strengthens + regulates smooth muscle for stubborn constipation. 
it's very useful for leaky gut. this is easily resolved with yellow dock in a simple formula if you're eating cleanly and consuming the necessities.

it is also my favorite remedy for acid reflux.
because it's a 'regulator' it can be used to cool and drain excess fire in the stomach and insides that leads to excessive hunger, excessive emotions, excessive libido. 
these people often tend to feel hot, have red on their face/tendency to redness, acid reflux. 

yellow dock seems to balance stomach acid, both high and low. 
this is another reason that it's wonderful for iron deficiency because proper assimilation depends on healthy stomach acid and iron is absorbed in the stomach. 

it can clean up and cool blood, which can be the root of liver troubles as well as troublesome skin imbalances. 
in general i like it for hot, seepy, ulcerated situations (throat, mouth, gums, privates, insides)
i also like it for some cases of excessive urination. 

CONSIDERATION FOR THOSE WITH ANEMIA + TRAUMA HISTORY
trauma is a shock to the nervous system. it can dysregulate appropriate chemical responses. building blood is something that happens in the marrow of your bones

AN IMPORTANT NOTE ON ACID REFLUX + SERIOUS GI ISSUES
i just want to be clear that acid reflux and gi distress can have a small handful of root causes. if there are certain foods that cause you clear distress, avoiding those foods is important.

products.title: Spotted Tiger Lily Bulbettes
products.description:
Another fantastic flower for you garden folks!

If you have never had the pleasure of growing these beauties, here are some tips to get you started off:

The bulbettes that you receive will be ready to plant upon arrival, you can either start them in a pot or take them straight to the garden. Do NOT plant these in the ground deeply. They prefer to be close to the surface. In my garden I simply sprinkle them on the ground and cover them with 1/2" of mulch.

They prefer an area that has partial shade, but they will grow in full shade to full sun. Ones that are grown in full sun tend to have fewer flowers, while ones that are grown in full shade tend to be shorter plants with many blooms.

Your tiger lilies will grow 12-16" the first year. The first year rarely yields a blossom. It will however begin to produce bulbettes after the first year. These little ladies love to spread around! By year two you can expect to see 3-5 blooms per plant and an average height around 38". At year 3 your plants will mature into 40-48" tall beauties with 6-12 blooms per plant. Each year your tiger lilies will produce multiple bulbettes in the fall. You can let them drop and move around freely in your flower garden, or you can pop the bulbettes off and share with friends.

Tiger lilies don't need constant watering like many flowers do. Rainfall is usually enough to keep them healthy. If you are in a hotter region of the states occasional water baths in the evenings are welcomed. These make excellent border plants for gardens, and also are great choices to drop in by the mailbox post as they require little care to maintain.

Each lot will have 25 bulbettes in it. Keep in mind that these are not bulbs, no need for a shovel! The bulbettes are roughly the size of dried peas. If you would like a larger quantity let me know and I will see what I can come up with.

If you have any questions please feel free to contact me with them.

metadata.product_usage: Bulbettes are for gardening.
metadata.product_arrival: Your bulbettes will arrive via USPS.
metadata.product_storage: The bulbettes will be ready to plant upon arrival. If your growing season is a ways off, simply take them out of the plastic baggie and store them in a paper bag out of direct sunlight until you are ready to plant.

products.title: Eschscholzia Californica - California poppy 1oz
products.description:
California poppy tincture has calming effect,  promoting relaxation, reducing mild pain, and enhancing sleep.

The California poppy has a long history in folk medicine for its sedative properties. It helps reduce anxiety, and is one of the main ingredients used in holistic tinctures to promote sleep.

The California poppy contains a variety of plant compounds, including alkaloids. These compounds act on GABA receptors inhibiting neuron firing. GABA, which are distributed throughout your central nervous system is one of the main neurotransmitters responsible for sleep regulation.

The California poppy (Eschscholzia californica) is a flower that belongs to the Papaveraceae or poppy plant family.

This material and the resulting tincture is made from fresh picked plants and flowers only. We never use dried herb for this tincture.

products.description:
This listing is for fresh sapodilla fruits (manilkara zapota). Sapodilla is also known as nispero, sapota, chikoo, and naseberry. Sapodilla is native to Central America and the Caribbean. It’s flavor and texture can be described as a brown sugar pear. Soft and juicy, very sweet. 

Sapodillas should be eaten when soft and the skin can be easily removed with a fingertip. 

----------

CALIFORNIA BUYERS: Sapodillas are NOT approved for shipment to CA. Orders of sapodilla fruits to CA will be canceled and refunded.
